title.title: The Correspondence of John Hunt and Joshua Evans

msIdentifier.institution: Friends Historical Library of Swarthmore College

projectDesc.p: The correspondence of Quaker ministers John Hunt and Joshua Evans are stored at the Friends Historical Library of Swarthmore College. With the generous support of H. David and Joyce E. Hunt, Library staff scanned and transcribed these letters in 2023 and encoded the text in TEI. The 2023 project also included researching individuals mentioned in the text to create and update records about them in the Social Networks and Archival Context website

div.p: Great God the time is now come when thou art pleased to afflict me; but at this time and all others, praised be thy Holy Name, this is thy appointment, & I submit. I know it is for some wise end. The return of this calamity, the manner, the continuance of my afflictions are all of thy permitting. Great source of being this is thy hour which thou from all eternity has ordained to be the season of my present discomfort, but the instruments of my future happiness & glory. It is good for me that I am in trouble, that I may learn thy salutes, for nothing is or can be done without thy providence or direction without some wise or excellent design. Welcome then distress. Welcome disappointment if it teaches me resignation to my God.
remain within our borders, and the company of our beloved sisters from different parts of your continent who are now laboring among us hath been acceptable and encouraging.

closer.salute: We salute you in gospel love & remain your affectionate friends. Signed in and on behalf of the Meeting
